abstract.p: S J Rozan letter on Andrew Sullivan's May 21 Way We Live column holds pro-life argument will remain sanctimonious, hypocritical and specious as long as so-called life-life proponents fail to embrace women's right to choose

block.p: As usual, Andrew Sullivan's argument contains a germ of truth; and as usual, Sullivan can't find it. The so-called life-life position may be internally consistent, but until its proponents embrace a woman's right to choose family planning -- yes, birth control -- instead of working, as so many anti-choicers do, to prevent access to this information, the pro-life argument will remain sanctimonious, hypocritical and specious.
